isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO SERIES - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Each mainshaft gear must have its I.D. snap ring installed before placement on the mainshaft. Do not replace reverse gear I.D. snap ring.

Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with gear hub clutching teeth. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each mainshaft gear.
Axial clearance (end-play) limits are .005" to .012" (.13 to .3 mm) for all mainshaft gears.

If the axial clearance is less than the minimum .005" tolerance, the limit washer should be replaced with a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the axial clearance is greater than the maximum .012" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed. This will decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

step1.para: With mainshaft pilot-end down, secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Install Roller Pin In Keyway

step1.para: If previously removed, install the roll pin in keyway ( Figure 145).
Position the 3rd speed gear limit washer (white) in the mainshaft 1st or bottom groove with washer flat side up. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 146).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Washer Splines & Mainshaft Splines Align

step1.para: Start at the mainshaft bottom and install an air line in the keyway to lock the washer in place. As limit washers and gears are installed, continue to push the air line up ( Figure 146).

note.para: An air line or equivalent is used in the mainshaft keyway to align the components until assembly is complete.

step1.para: Install the 3rd speed gear spacer against the 3rd speed gear washer ( Figure 147).
With clutching teeth down and engaged with the spacer external splines, position the 3rd speed gear on the mainshaft ( Figure 148).
Position a mainshaft spacer against 3rd speed gear ( Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Mainshaft Spacer Against 3rd Speed Gear

step1.para: With the washer flat side down, position the limit washer against the spacer. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 150. Air Line Up to Lock Washer

step1.para: Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 150).
Insert a .005" feeler gauge and a .012" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 151). If out of tolerance, change the limit against the mainshaft spacer.
With the flat side up, position the 1st speed gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 152).

figure.caption: Figure 152. Washer Splines & Mainshaft Splines Align

step1.para: Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 152).
Position the mainshaft spacer against the limit washer ( Figure 153).
With clutching teeth up, position the 1st speed gear on the mainshaft against the spacer ( Figure 153).
Install 1st speed gear spacer against 1st speed gear, engaging the spacer external splines with gear clutching teeth ( Figure 154).

figure.caption: Figure 154. Air Line Up To Lock The Washer

step1.para: Position the limit washer with washer flat side down against the spacer. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 154).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 154).

Insert a .005" feeler gauge and .012" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 155). If out of tolerance, change the limit washer against the mainshaft spacer. Refer to the information at the beginning of this part.

figure.caption: Figure 155. Feeler Gauge To Check Tolerances

step1.para: Align the sliding clutch (without internal spline) with the mainshaft key and install the 1st-Reverse speed sliding clutch ( Figure 156).
With the flat side up, position the Reverse speed gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 157).

figure.caption: Figure 157. Washer Splines & Mainshaft Splines Align

step1.para: Push the air line up to lock the washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 157).
Position reverse speed gear spacer against the limit washer ( Figure 158).

figure.caption: Figure 158. Reverse Speed Gear Spacer Against Limit Washer

step1.para: Install reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the gear clutching teeth with spacer splines and sliding clutch. Move the reverse gear down against the 1st speed gear ( Figure 159).

Remove the air line and insert the mainshaft key ( Figure 159). Be careful not to move the gears while doing this procedure, the limit washers are unlocked and can rotate which would cause the gears to drop.
Install the mainshaft key snap ring.
Remove the mainshaft from the vise ( Figure 160).

At the pilot end of the mainshaft, align the sliding clutch with the mainshaft key and install the 3rd-Drive gear sliding clutch. Engage the sliding clutch external splines with the 3rd speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 160).
